title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 07 August 2015 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
06:05 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
06:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:09 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:17 <Ramona1> has quit  
08:42 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:52 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
10:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <evalica> has quit  
10:27 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <vmassol> good morning eveyrone btw (sorry I forgot to announce myself this morning!)  
10:39 <vmassol> I'm working on trying to fix the CompareVersionsTest so that it passes  
10:39 <vmassol> the issue is with the setParent(), I've fixed that by setting the parentchild mode but now I'm trying to understand why WikiEditPage.setParent() doesn't click on the parent icon to change the parent  
10:41 <Enygma`> Hi  
10:41 <Enygma`> I have an issue myself that I would like you advice on  
10:41 <Enygma`> There seems to be one more issue regarding the script right that I was under the impression I had already fixed: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/EditInlineTest/testEditorInitialContentWhenCreatingDocumentFromTemplate/  
10:41 <Enygma`> It`s about the "template" parameter in inline edit mode where the currently new document being edited gets its content, objects and some metadata from a template document. The issue is that the creator, author and, most importantly for script right, contentAuthor are not set in the edited document... so the code coming from the template's content can not be executed because the current document's contentAuthor is null (guest).  
10:41 <Enygma`> In the case of the preview action, we are explicitly setting the contentAuthor to the current user so that in preview mode PR works with the current user's rights. (see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/PreviewAction.java#L111)  
10:42 <Enygma`> I am wondering if we should do this inside EditAction#prepareEditedDocument (see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/web/EditAction.java#L85) so that all edit actions (inline, wiki, wysiwyg but also PreviewAction which inherits EditAction) behave in the same way (i.e. set the current user as author, contentAuthor and, in some cases, creator for the currently edited documen  
10:42 <Enygma`> The only noticeable behavior change I can imagine is that in an edit sheet (or in wysiwyg when previewing a velocity macro), doc.author, doc.contentAuthor and doc.creator will no longer display the previous author but will display the current context user. In WYSIWYG I can actually see this as an improvement, since it is currently not consistent with previewAction. For an edit sheet, if the previous author is really needed, the current document can be re-fet  
10:42 <Enygma`> WDYT?  
10:42 <vmassol> wow long and complex test to parse :)  
10:42 <Enygma`> I know... gotta love IRC for this sort of stuff :)  
10:42 <Enygma`> but it's not that complicated actually  
10:43 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> seems ok but I don't master the consequences as I don't know this code  
10:46 <Enygma`> I remember the admin action also had a similar problem, but I`ve fixed that by using the display script service. A better fix would have been to make the admin action inherit from edit action and apply the logic above.  
10:47 <Enygma`> tmortagne, mflorea: any objections to setting the current user as author/contentAuthor/(if isNew)creator for the currently edited document inside the EditAction directly?  
10:48 <vmassol> on my problem, I've jsut found out that the only test that calls setParent is actually CompareVersionsTest… meaning we don't have any func test for verifying that setting the parent works fine  
10:48 <Enygma`> IMO, it should have been that way rom the start  
10:48 <vmassol> so it probably got broken in GD's refactoring, checking what he did  
10:49 <Enygma`> vmassol: I remember seeing some tests that were setting the parent in edit mode  
10:49 <Enygma`> in the past  
10:49 <vmassol> maybe my grep wasn't good  
10:50 <vmassol> but I've used find usage from my IDE so should be ok  
10:50 <meatcar> has quit  
10:52 <meatcar> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <Enygma`> yes, I get the same results  
10:52 <Enygma`> maybe it was this one...  
10:53 <vmassol> what I don't understan Enygma` is that the hiearchy icon in edit mode has been there for a while AFAIK  
10:54 <vmassol> and I don't see how CopareVersionsTest could have worked before our NS changes since setParent() doesn't click on it  
10:54 <vmassol> and thus when it tries to change the parent field, it says it's not visible (obviusly)  
10:54 <Enygma`> well, maybe Guillaume removed all the tests about it when he disabled the parent change button by default  
10:54 <Enygma`> otherwise the build would have failed  
10:54 <vmassol> I've checked  
10:54 <vmassol> and GD didn't change the hierarchy icon behavior  
10:54 <vmassol> it was there before  
10:54 <Enygma`> no, I mean the tests about it  
10:55 <Enygma`> since we can`t find many right now  
10:55 <vmassol> sure but it would have meant they were all failing  
10:55 <vmassol> which wasn't the case  
10:55 <Enygma`> maybe I should run a test locally to better see what you mean  
10:56 <vmassol> when you edit a page  
10:56 <vmassol> you have this little hierarchy icon  
10:56 <vmassol> when you click on it  
10:56 <woshilap1n> has joined #xwiki  
10:56 <vmassol> it displays the parent field  
10:56 <vmassol> so that you can change it  
10:56 <vmassol> for ex: http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/VMA?editor=wiki  
10:56 <Enygma`> yep and now we need to put something in xwiki.preferences to have that again, right?  
10:56 <vmassol> sure that's ok  
10:56 <vmassol> that's not the problem  
10:57 <vmassol> (I have that change locally)  
10:57 <vmassol> the problem is in WikiEditPage.setParent()  
10:57 <vmassol> the code there expects the parent field to be visible  
10:57 <vmassol> (ie that someone has clicked on the hierarchy icon before it's called)  
10:58 <woshilapin> has quit  
10:58 <vmassol> I can change the code  to do that but I'm wondering how it could have passed before  
10:58 <Enygma`> if (!this.parentInput.isDisplayed()) {  
10:58 <Enygma`>             this.editParentTrigger.click();  
10:58 <Enygma`> looks like it clicks it if it`s not already clicked  
10:58 <vmassol> ah yes indeed  
10:59 <vmassol> missed that because it's failing on the line before that  
10:59 <vmassol> the find  
10:59 <vmassol> ok thanks  
10:59 <vmassol> I can now continue  
10:59 <vmassol> I'll fix a few things which are strange  
11:00 <Enygma`> ok, cool  
11:01 <Enygma`> yes, the test seems to be working with parentchild enabled  
11:01 <Enygma`> but probably fails if I switch back to reference (since setParent will probably fail)  
11:01 <vmassol> good for you, fails locally here  
11:01 <Enygma`> what fails, setParent?  
11:02 <Enygma`> with parentchild enabled?  
11:02 <vmassol> I've made some changes and it seems to be working now albeit very slowly locally each lines takes 30 s to execute  
11:19 <mflorea> has quit  
11:29 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <vmassol> ok for some reasons it keeps failing locally, maybe some browser refresh, anyone going to commit and see how it goes on ci and I'll contine debugging  
11:42 <tmortagne> Enygma`: "any objections to setting the current user as author/contentAuthor/(if isNew)creator for the currently edited document inside the EditAction directly", content author supposed to change only if the content actually change  
11:44 <Enygma`> tmortagne: yes, was thinking about that... though, for wysiwyg and wiki edit modes that is valid... for inline edit is not guaranteed and for object edit is not valid  
11:45 <tmortagne> it's not guaranteed either for wiki and wysiwyg edit mode  
11:45 <Enygma`> even so, it's only for the in-memory document that is being edited. When actually saving, the contentAuthor will change in the DB only if the content actually changed as a result of the edit  
11:46 <tmortagne> it's not that simple what is saved in the "in-memory document"  
11:46 <Enygma`> wdym?  
11:46 <tmortagne> so if you change the author it will be saved in the DB too  
11:47 <tmortagne> if it's for the edit display only I don't see the point since obviously the document was not modified  
11:47 <tmortagne> so I don't see why the author would change  
11:48 <tmortagne> it will indicate wrong information to a sheet for example  
11:48 <Enygma`> that`s what I`ve said above... $doc.author will show the current user instead of the previous author... but a sheet can re-fecth the document from the DB if it needs that info  
11:48 <tmortagne> IMO the author should change when it make sense and setting the author when the document has not been modified in any way does not make sense  
11:49 <tmortagne> it does not bring anything and force the UI to not trust the context document anymore...  
11:50 <Enygma`> in wysiwyg for example, when displaying a velocity macro... $doc.author displays "" (guest) for a new document  
11:50 <tmortagne> also this would be a serious security issue in the WYSIWYG since the document would be executed with the right of the current user  
11:50 <Enygma`> in that case, it`s not exactly wysiwyg  
11:50 <Enygma`> but don`t you want that?  
11:51 <tmortagne> not when you start editing a document you did not wrote  
11:51 <tmortagne> if you start modify it then yes  
11:51 <tmortagne> again the author should change when you actually change something  
11:52 <Enygma`> what bout the actual problem, regarding code content coming from template?  
11:52 <Enygma`> should the template document be used as security document, if a template document is specified?  
11:53 <Enygma`> since that is where the code content comes from  
11:54 <tmortagne> pretty sure mflorea did something special for templates already but this is a different sibject  
11:54 <Enygma`> (however, in wysiwyg or wiki edit mode you are then free to modify the content that came from a template so it does not make sense there)  
11:55 <Enygma`> when using a sheet, the sheet document is the security document  
11:55 <Enygma`> but for templates, I don`t see anything handled  
11:55 <Enygma`> so, for example, AFAICT, we can not have PR code in templates right now  
11:56 <Enygma`> since they are executed in the context of the current document  
11:56 <Enygma`> the code(content) is simply copied in the current document  
11:57 <tmortagne> well that's what a template is supposed to be, just a copy  
11:57 <Enygma`> yes...  
11:57 <Enygma`> so you can not use a template that contains code if your user does not have script rights  
11:57 <Enygma`> and that should make sense, right?  
11:58 <Enygma`> a workaround is for the template to have a sheet attached to it  
11:58 <Enygma`> and that sheet should have PR/SR  
11:59 <Enygma`> or if you use template=X&sheet=Y.... (and Y has SR/PR) everything is fine and the code inside X is rendered by sheet Y if sheet Y chooses to  
11:59 <tmortagne> you are talking about a new document here and I was talking about editing an existing document  
11:59 <tmortagne> for a new document you can put current user  
12:00 <tmortagne> creating a document is by definition modifying it already  
12:01 <vmassol> guys we need to finish fixng the faiiling tests asap  
12:01 <vmassol> if I don't start the release around 14-15:00 then it's going to be dead for me as I leave for holidays around 18:00 tonight  
12:03 <tmortagne> sure, out for lunch and will look at UI test after  
12:04 <vmassol> (btw I have to go to the doctor at 16:00 too for my hand which is not healing properly)  
12:04 <vmassol> ok thanks tmortagne  
12:09 <Enygma`> I`m already working on this as well

12:47 <vmassol> but setParent is failing  
12:47 <vmassol> it says that the editParentTrigger is not visible  
12:47 <vmassol> maybe this icon is added by some js  
12:47 <vmassol> I'll add a wait to see if it helps  
12:48 <vmassol> but I doubt it  
12:49 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
12:54 <vmassol> actually it's possible it's that since I since xwiki.js is manipulating it. I wonder if it's not a problem of refresh though  
12:54 <vmassol> since xwiki.js needs to be reloaded after the setting is chaged as I see in it:  
12:55 <vmassol> if ($services.parentchild.isParentChildMechanismEnabled()) {  
12:55 <vmassol> document.observe('xwiki:dom:loaded', function() {  
12:55 <tmortagne> vmassol:  confirm again that the xwiki-enterprise-test-extension test are working well locally, for some reason 5 of them are contently failing on jenkins. We'll have to debug them but it's not a blocker for the relase  
12:57 <vmassol> ok…  
12:57 <tmortagne> CompareVersionsTest.testNoChanges is failing because for some reason the document only have one version when it try to get a diff  
12:57 <vmassol> I'm on CompareVersionsTest  
12:58 <vmassol> (since yesterday)  
12:58 <tmortagne> ok  
12:59 <vmassol> refresh didn't work…  
12:59 <vmassol> nor the wait for visible  
12:59 <tmortagne> note that last xwiki-enterprise-test-ui is built on 2-3 which has issue with native events support according to mflorea  
13:00 <tmortagne> so maybe it's the issue for most tests  
13:00 <vmassol> I can reproduce CompareVersionsT'est locally  
13:01 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:21 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:25 <tmortagne> ok so userlist suggest works well in standard object editor but it's indeed broken in the AWM class editor  
13:26 <tmortagne> that's what makes 5 test fail in xwiki-enterprise-test-ui  
13:31 <vmassol> ok got it to pass, committing  
13:42 <vmassol> so indeed the trick was to force a refresh since xwiki.js behavior depends on the core.hierarchyMode property  
13:43 <vmassol> ok so who's fixing userlist suggest in AWM?  
13:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: so here is the issue  
13:45 <tmortagne> it's not a AWM bug actually  
13:46 <tmortagne> what is broken is that user suggest service require current user to have PR  
13:46 <tmortagne> and it happen that AWM use a basic user in its test  
13:46 <tmortagne> trying to see exactly what require PR and why  
13:47 <tmortagne> as far as I can see it's using trying to execute a query that require PR  
13:48 <vmassol> seems marius has left for holiday BTW (just realizing now)  
13:49 <tmortagne> ok I see what is wrong, it's because of the change in the way to handle query rights  
13:49 <vmassol> ok cool that you identified it!  
13:51 <tmortagne> the issue is that XWQL -> HQL converter generate complete query and put complete class name (com.xpn.xwiki.objects.StringProperty instead of StringProperty) and jsqlparser (which is used to parse the query to validate for rights) does not like it too much  
13:52 <tmortagne> does not seems to be all the time since otherwise it would fail everywhere  
13:52 <vmassol> I hope there's no failing tests where we require marius' input/help  
13:53 <vmassol> I need to start cutting the release in 30 minutes or so  
13:54 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <vmassol> (bb, lunch time)  
14:17 <Enygma`> looking into http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/ImageTest/testInsertImageFromPageWithSpecialCharactersInName/

14:27 <vmassol> and we need this finalzed before we can finish the release  
14:27 <vmassol> checking mine, I have 2 or 3

14:30 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/testReport/org.xwiki.test.wysiwyg/ImageTest/testInsertImageFromPageWithSpecialCharactersInName/ seems to be caused by the copy UI now expecting a target space reference instead of a target space name... and the test checks for escaping issues when passing an unclean name. Making sure the passed target space is an escaped reference inste  
14:30 <Enygma`> so fixing the test

15:16 <Slashman> when I try the "check for updates" button of the extension updater, it seems stuck too, any idea how I can upgrade those 3 extensions?

It would be great if I could start the release in 1 hour when I'm back BTW as otherwise it's going to be too late afterwards :)

16:01 <Enygma`> - UserClassFieldTest.\* are done by tmortagne AFAIU and just need to finish building

16:03 <vmassol> the goal is not to have the full api  
16:03 <vmassol> but updating existing examples to show how to construct NS references is a good thing  
16:04 <vmassol> got to go  
16:08 <Enygma`> ApplicationNameTest/testExistingAppName fails because of the breadcrumb... it is expecting "The Wiki Blog" to be present in the breadcrumb (parent's title) but we no display "BlogCode" (code space name)  
16:08 <Enygma`> fixing the test...  
16:09 <Enygma`> so we should be good

17:53 <Enygma`> very curious these 2 tests how they start failing only now http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/testReport/  
17:53 <Enygma`> first 2  (related to breadcrumbs)
